plugins.name: Tetrisly Plugin
plugins.description:
Thanks to two core features, the Plugin Tetrisly Tools is a vital bridge between design and code within the Tetrisly ecosystem. The primary innovation is the export of tokens from Figma files to .json files, facilitating their easy integration into code. This automated export replicates the entire tokens/variables structure, eliminating developers' need for manual token recreation.


The plugin also simplifies token customization, automatically updating related tokens when modified. Tetrisly users no longer need to click through the whole token structure and manually change tokens on each level.

Focus on product delivery. Design right away and ship faster.

  3. Flutter (Dart)

  3. String
  4. Boolean


Key Features:

  1. Dark/Light mode support
  2. Automatic Variable Alias resolution
  3. Responsive design support

Important Notes:

plugins.name: Text2CSS
plugins.description:
Text2CSS is a powerful Figma plugin that transforms your text styles into clean, customizable CSS code. Whether you're using standard CSS, Tailwind, SCSS, SASS, or inline styles, Text2CSS gives you full control over the output ‚Äî including unit preferences (px, rem, em), color formats (hex, short hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla, and named CSS colors), and custom class/ID naming conventions.


Designed for both developers and designers, Text2CSS makes it easy to export typography from Figma into production-ready code. With advanced formatting options and support for modern CSS workflows, it streamlines your handoff process and keeps your styles consistent across projects.

plugins.name: BulkMeta
plugins.description:
Are you tired of wasting time manually editing component descriptions and documentation URLs in Figma? Streamline your design system management with BulkMeta! BulkMeta allows you to export all component metadata from your Figma libraries, including descriptions, documentation URLs and names, as a JSON file. With the exported JSON file, you can easily make quick sweeping changes to your component metadata using an external editor like VS Code. Once you're done, simply import the modified JSON file back into Figma, and voila! Your design system is updated with minimal effort.


How To Use


  1. Run the BulkMeta plugin and click the "Export" button to generate a JSON file containing your component metadata
  2. Open the JSON file in a text editor like VS Code and modify the component metadata
  3. Create a new branch of your current Figma library if you have the option
  4. Run the BulkMeta plugin and click the "Import" button and select the updated JSON file
  5. Watch all the component metadata update with your new changes
  6. If you are happy with the changes, merge the branch
  7. Profit


Export Component Variants


You can choose to include component variants in your export so you can be ultra detailed on your documentation. Though, depending on how many variants you have, you could be spending a lot of time editing your metadata.


Editing JSON File


A couple of quick rules when editing your JSON file:


  • DO NOT EDIT THE ID - The ID is what is used to match your updated metadata to the component when importing your updated JSON file.
  • If you have paragraphs in your descriptions they are represented as \n\n in the description metadata
  • If you have exported component variants you will see parentName metadata. THIS IS NOT USED, it is only a reference for you so you can be sure what component set the variant belongs to
  • You CAN modify the component name!


Love BulkMeta? Buy me a coffee ü§©

accepted.description:

plugins.name: IconLab - Simplify Your Icons
plugins.description:
IconLab: Simplify, Flatten, and Unify Your Icons


What is IconLab?

IconLab is a powerful Figma plugin designed to clean up and optimize your icons with ease. It simplifies, merges, and standardizes layers, helping you maintain an efficient and organized design workflow. Whether you're working with complex icon sets or refining a design system, IconLab ensures your icons are clean, lightweight, and production-ready.


What does it do?

IconLab offers a set of intelligent automation tools to refine and simplify your icons:

  1. Remove unnecessary groups and frames ‚Äì Eliminates redundant frames, groups, and nested structures for a cleaner design.
  2. Merge all layers into one ‚Äì Combines multiple fills and strokes into a single optimized layer.
  3. Remove extra nodes ‚Äì Cleans up redundant vector points without affecting the shape of your icon.
  4. Standardize names and colors ‚Äì Ensures all icons have consistent names and colors for a uniform design system.
  5. Ensure proper scaling ‚Äì Ensures every icon is a single, properly scaled layer.
  6. Remove placeholder layers ‚Äì Detects and deletes unnecessary 24x24 placeholder rectangles often found in icon packs.


Who is it for?

IconLab is built for:

  1. UI/UX Designers ‚Äì Quickly flatten and optimize icons for better usability.
  2. DesignOps & Design System Managers ‚Äì Maintain consistency across projects with standardized icon structures.


Why Use IconLab?

  1. üöÄ Save Time ‚Äì Automate repetitive tasks and focus on design.
  2. üé® Keep Files Clean ‚Äì Keep your Figma workspace structured and clutter-free.
  3. ‚ö° Boost Performance ‚Äì Lighter files result in faster Figma workflows.
  4. üîÑ Iterate Faster ‚Äì Simplified layers make editing and exporting effortless.


How Does It Work?

Simply select your icons in Figma and run IconLab. The plugin will automatically simplify, merge, and clean up your layers‚Äîno manual adjustments needed.


If you have any feedback or suggestions about the plugin, please feel free to email me so we can improve it. Your input is greatly appreciated!


vamehrad@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Flatten, simplify and unify icons with smart merging, node cleanup, and seamless design consistency

plugins.name: Generate 01
plugins.description:
Generate is prompt-to-design copilot that creates variations of your brand assets within seconds.


Plugin is in public beta.

Sign up via plugin and get 50 free generation credits.


Use cases

Quickly populate assets with text and images

Generate variations of assets using brand styles

Bulk translate assets to different languages

Create custom presentations for different clients

Generate on-demand portfolio visuals

Many more


Get started

‚ñ∏ Watch file setup tutorial (3:43)

‚ú∂ Play with prompts in a demo file


To use "Generate" with your file, you will need to add designs from which to generate and describe what to customize in these designs. The setup usually takes 3 minutes:

  1. Select a frame and run "Generate ‚Üí Add Template" to add template. Describe how and when to use the template. Add several templates, or stick to only one design. The frame should be in a section or in the root of your file page.
  2. Select a layer inside your template to describe how to use it via "Generate ‚Üí Add Layer". Specify which fills, strokes, or effects styles to apply. Describe how to generate text including tone of voice and number of words.
  3. Generate new variations by typing a prompt. When prompting, make sure to mention how many variants you need, changes you want to apply, specific template or size of the frame.

Explore step by step the manual in the playground file. This plugin uses existing styles, so make sure to add all the text, fill, effect and stroke styles.


Features

‚úß Generate from images. Drag and drop images to Figma and use them with your templates

‚úß Generate with text. Add text to Figma, and describe how to use it in a template.

‚úß Assign file instructions. Describe the high-level rules for every generation

‚úß File handoff. Setup the rules for the file and give access to your team


Support

Report a bug

Discord

Email


Thank you for your interest in "Generate" beta

Leave feedback

Request more generations
plugins.tagline: AI copilot guided by your design system

plugins.name: Automotive Design for Compose
plugins.description:
Automotive Design for Compose is an extension to Jetpack Compose. It allows every screen, component, and overlay to be defined in Figma. To use Automotive Design for Compose in an app, the developer specifies the Composables that they‚Äôd like to be defined by Figma, and the designer draws them. Most Figma features, including Auto Layout, Interactions, and Blend Modes are fully supported.


The plugin

The Automotive Design for Compose plugin performs several essential functions in the design workflow:

  1. Live text format: specify how multiple lines of text should be presented
  2. Check document for errors: review design doc for any keyword tagging errors
  3. Check/update keywords: ensure your design doc is using the latest set of keywords
  4. Sync prototype changes: push latest prototype version to Live View
  5. Localization tool: pull strings from the figma design and generate a strings xml file, pull images from figma design and generate a drawable.zip file
  6. Support to set shader code as a background or a stroke for a node


Get started

Automotive Design for Compose is open source. Download the Figma plugin here, and then head over to our GitHub repo to download the SDK and check out a tutorial.

Suggestions and/or feedback? Send it here.

accepted.name: Automotive Design for Compose
accepted.description: Automotive Design for Compose enables design-driven UI development with AAOS.

This is a text analysis tool for writing Japanese that is easy to understand as a practical text.


You can check sentences in a selected text layer from the following perspectives.


  1. Do not use documents that are too long
  2. Do not use too many reading marks
  3. Do not use consecutive Kanji characters
  4. Use Chinese numerals and alphanumeric characters appropriately
  5. Do not use double negatives
  6. Do not use "„ÇâÊäú„ÅçË®ÄËëâ".
  7. Do not use the same conjunction consecutively
  8. Do not use the same particle too often
  9. Do not use redundant expressions
  10. Do not mix "„Åß„Åô" "„Åæ„Åô" and "„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã" styles.
  11. Use Kanji and Hiragana appropriately



Caution


You can change the threshold values of the rules, but since Figma storage is used, the threshold settings cannot be shared.


If you wish to use the same threshold settings across files or share threshold settings with other users, please use Notion Linkage.


Click here for detailed setting instructions.




Future Plans for Functional Enhancements


  1. Real-time checking
  2. Setting rules on a per-component basis

  6. Do not use "„ÇâÊäú„ÅçË®ÄËëâ".
  7. Do not use the same conjunction consecutively
  8. Do not use the same particle too often
  9. Do not use redundant expressions
  10. Do not mix "„Åß„Åô" "„Åæ„Åô" and "„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã" styles.
  11. Use Kanji and Hiragana appropriately



Caution


You can change the threshold values of the rules, but since Figma storage is used, the threshold settings cannot be shared.


If you wish to use the same threshold settings across files or share threshold settings with other users, please use Notion Linkage.


Click here for detailed setting instructions.




Future Plans for Functional Enhancements

  2. Setting rules on a per-component basis

plugins.name: Resize Commands
plugins.description:
Inspired by the original "Resize Commands" plugin for Sketch (https://github.com/ajilderda/Sketch-Resize-Commands), this plugin lets you resize one or multiple layers with simple commands, by typing them like so: "l+50". You can also combine multiple commands by seperating them with a comma, like so: "l+50,r+20". If you check the box "Ignore Constraints", the elements will be resized without applying the individual constraints.

Developed at Syncier.

The following directions are supported at the moment:
l -> left
r -> right
t -> top
b -> bottom
w -> width (same as "right")
h -> height (same as "bottom")
x -> x-axis
y -> y-axis

The following operators are supported at the moment:
+ -> plus
- -> minus
= -> set x, y, w or h

You can apply the command by hitting "Enter".

accepted.name: Mark Meyer
accepted.description: Interaction / Strategic Designer

plugins.name: Arcade: Turn designs into interactive demos
plugins.description:
From passive to interactive storytelling: Export your designs to Arcade and turn them into engaging, on-brand demos.


Arcade is an interactive demo platform that allows teams to create effortlessly beautiful demos in minutes.


Arcade‚Äôs Figma plugin allows you to transform static designs into interactive, clickable demos, enabling faster feedback, better collaboration, and more engaging product storytelling.


To get started, select the frames or layers to export to Arcade. With the click of a button, the plug-in will convert them to an interactive demo.


Teams are using the Arcade plugin for:

‚òÜ Design reviews

‚òÜ Gathering customer feedback on new features

‚òÜ Sharing product roadmap in sales conversations

‚òÜ Product launches

‚òÜ Personalizing UI for collateral and customer demos


This plugin is built for designers, marketers, and product teams that need to showcase product functionality and design in an interactive way.


Getting started with Arcade:

Arcade has free and paid plan options. Sign up for free at https://www.arcade.software


Here are some feature highlights from each plan:


Free plan:

  6. Background colors/music


Paid plans:

  5. Forms and form embeds
  6. Commenting
  7. HTML editing


‚Ä¶ and more!


We can‚Äôt wait to see what you build.

plugins.name: Coordinates from centre
plugins.description:
When selecting an object that is nested within a Frame, this plugin will show you the object coordinates relative to the centre of the Frame and the centre of the object.


You can use the copy buttons to easily copy the coordinates to the clipboard.


Current limitations:

  1. It doesn't show accurate coordinates of objects nested within components.
  2. When objects are not snapped to the pixel grid, whether because of the user settings or because of a layout group positioning, the resulting coordinates will be rounded to the closest integer.
plugins.tagline: Get the coordinages of a selected object relative to the center of the parent Frame.

plugins.name: Image Background Remover
plugins.description:
Image Background Remover


Instantly remove backgrounds from your images with our powerful and easy-to-use plugin.


Features:


  1. One-Click Background Removal: Simply select an image and let our AI do the rest.
  2. High-Quality Results: Get precise cutouts with clean edges.
  3. Multiple Input Methods: Upload images, paste URLs, or drag and drop directly from your desktop.
  4. Preview and Edit: See the results before applying, with options to adjust if needed.
  5. Figma Integration: Seamlessly add the processed images to your Figma designs.


How to Use:


1. Upload images, paste URLs, or drag and drop directly from your desktop.

2. Click the "Remove Background" button.

3. Wait a few seconds for the AI to process your image.

4. Your image will appear with the background removed, ready to use in your design.


Limitations:


  1. Maximum image size: 1.5MB
  2. Maximum resolution: 2000x2000 pixels
  3. Supported formats: PNG, JPEG, WebP
  4. Free tier: 10 image processes per month


Pro Version:


Unlock unlimited background removals and priority processing with our Pro version. Perfect for designers who work with images frequently.


Privacy & Security:


We take your data seriously. All image processing is done securely, and we do not store your images after processing.


Transform your design workflow with our Image Background Remover plugin. Say goodbye to tedious manual cutouts and hello to more time for creativity!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly remove image background. Precise, and user-friendly. Elevate your designs with ease.

138867.release_notes:
New Token Preview Feature
- Added live token preview to see exactly what will be generated before creating tokens
- Plugin automatically expands to show preview panel alongside settings
- Filter tabs let you quickly view Colors, Spacing, Typography, or Borders
- Independent Light/Dark and 1x/2x zoom controls for exploring different modes
- Click any token to copy it to clipboard with instant Figma notification
- Color tokens show visual swatches for easy identification

Performance Improvements
- Mode switching is now instant - no waiting for regeneration
- Scroll position preserved when changing filters or modes
- Preview updates in real-time as you change settings

Typography Enhancements
- Line heights now calculated automatically for perfect readability
- All line heights use 120% of font size, rounded to fit 8px grid system
- Updated font system to use Geist and Geist Mono
- Fixed font loading issues that caused console errors

- Technical Updates
- Complete accuracy between preview and actual token generation
- Improved error handling and stability
- Enhanced Tailwind v3 and v4 export compatibility
- Better semantic color token organization

What This Means for You
The new preview feature eliminates guesswork - you can now see your complete token system, test different modes, and copy specific tokens before committing to generation. The typography improvements ensure consistent, grid-aligned text styling across your design system.

plugins.name: QML Style Export
plugins.description:
Overview

A Figma plugin that converts selected Figma elements into QML code, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma designs and Qt/QML development.


Supported Elements

- Frames: Converts to QML `Item` or `Rectangle` with layout properties

- Components: Generates reusable QML components with variant support

- Component Instances: Handles component instantiation with property overrides

- Rectangles* Converts to QML `Rectangle` with styling properties

- Text: Converts to QML `Text` with font properties

- Ellipses: Converts to QML shape elements


Styling Properties

- Colors (fill and stroke)

- Dimensions (width and height)

- Border properties

- Corner radius

- Opacity

- Visibility

- Drop shadows

- Font properties

- Gradients


Layout Support

- Auto-layout (horizontal and vertical)

- Spacing and padding

- Alignment properties

- Parent-child relationships

- Anchoring


Component Features

- Reusable component generation

- Variant handling through states

- Property overrides

- Nested component support


Usage

1. Select Elements

- Select one or more elements in your Figma design

2. Export QML

- Click the "Export QML" button

- The generated QML code appears in the textarea

3. Clear Output

- Use the "Clear" button to reset the output area


Integration

The generated QML code can be directly used in Qt projects, maintaining the visual fidelity of the Figma designs while following Qt best practices and conventions.

accepted.name: tyles
accepted.description: DRINK. DESIGN. REPEAT.

plugins.tagline: Converts selected Figma elements into QML, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures

3. Clear Output

- Use the "Clear" button to reset the output area


Integration

The generated QML code can be directly used in Qt projects, maintaining the visual fidelity of the Figma designs while following Qt best practices and conventions.
107099.tagline: Converts selected Figma elements into QML, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures

plugins.name: J4F
plugins.description:
J4F (Jira for Figma) helps you to manage your Jira issues right from Figma. You can change issues status and attach related frames links to the issue in one click. No more jumping between tabs and copy-pasting links.


J4F is not affiliated with Jira or Figma, it's developed by a third-party developer.


Before you start, please open "Settings" and fill required data.


The plugin requires an internet connection for work.


We are in beta now, we will be glad to get any feedback and feature requests right here in comments or by email to karimshakirov+j4f@gmail.com.


We are using Mixpanel for analytics to make our product better. We store your Email, Jira URL, and Documents IDs to create customer profiles to understand different usage scenarios. We will not share or sell your data.


Pricing: While in Beta, J4F will be free, later we might change the pricing model.
